Precondition:

  • SSO is always active, ie no module is needed to activate or disable it

  • Password will not be set in application anymore, but in SSO Provider

Workflows that should be enabled

ID

Title

Workflow

W1

Create

  • User is created in application with the following properties

    • Name

    • First name

    • E-mail

    • (Accout name?)

  • Sync user data and application url to SSO Provider and create new user

  • Activation mail to new user

    • Login link of the application (installation)

      • user clicks on the link and is forwarded to a page where he needs to enter a password

      • after confirming the password he is logged in the application

  • Same user is created in an additional application

    • Sync user data and application url to SSO Provider

  • User will see Login mask only once session is expired

W2A

Edit (Sync process)

Change in application (Sync Upwards)

  • User data is changed in one application

    • New Name

    • New First name

    • New E-mail

    • (Accout name?)

  • Sync changed user data to SSO Provider

  • In case e-mail is changed, the user gets a mail from SSO provider where he needs to confirm the change by clicking on a validation link

  • After confirming when user logs in a second application SSO provider syncs new data to application

    • if user has not logged in yet, old data is being used

  • In case Name / First name is changed, no mail is sent by SSO provider at all

Change in SSO provider (Sync Downwards)

  • User data is changed centrally in SSO provider

    • New Name

    • New First name

    • New E-mail

    • (Accout name?)

  • As soon as user logs in one of the application SSO provider syncs user’s data to application

W2B

Alternative: Immediate Sync

Once user data are changed in one application, these are synced to SSO provider and all applications user has access to

W3

Deletion - Deletion in application

  • In case a user is existing in several applications and he gets deleted in one of them then he will be removed from the application on SSO provider side

  • User can still use SSO in the application he is still existing

  • In case user is deleted from last application he is completely removed from SSO provider wrt

    • Name

    • First name

    • E-mail

    • (account name?)

    • PW

    • MFA

    • Application url

  • In case a deleted user tries to access the application he is removed from he would see an application based message, eg. you are not authorized to access this application

W4

Deletion - Deletion centrally in SSO provider (SHOULD DO)

In case user is deleted centrally from SSO provider a deletion process is triggerred automatically in all respective application

W5

Federation - Create

  • User will not be able to register by himself

  • When user is created on AD side and synced to SSO provider he will not receive a activation mail from SSO provider and he will not be asked to add a password

  • When user accesses application via sso (Login mask) his data will be double checked in SSO provider

    • if user is known, he will directly log into application

    • if user is not known, he will see an app based message

W6

Federation - Edit

AD changes

When user data are changed in AD these are synced over to SSO provider once user logs into application and his data will be updated

Alternative: user changes from AD are pushed to SSO provider

Application / SSO provider changes

In case user data are changed in one application, these are synced to SSO provider or in case changes occur in SSO provider data are synced to application BUT

  • No data sync occurs to AD (Sync Downwards)

  • Customer needs to update data also in one application,

    • otherwise when user logs out and logs in application again: AD data sync to SSO provider overwrites the application changes again

W7

Federation - Delete

Deletion in AD

When user is deleted within AD nothing happens in SSO provider, since system doesn'
t get any information

  • Customer needs to delete data from any single application

Deletion in application

see above and AD is untouched

Deletion in SSO provider

see above and AD is untouched

W8

Login mask

  • The Tivian Access Login would contain two input fields

    • E-mail address

    • PW

    • Forgot PW link

  • For inactive session:

    • Homerealm Discovery page: In case user enters application url manually he needs to enter his mail address

      • user is forwarded to the external AD

      • otherwise password needs to be entered

    • In case user accesses the application URL via activation mail, the email address woul be prefilled and cannot be edited

    • In case a wrong PW is entered, an error message appears

  • In case of active session login mask is not shown, ie user logs directly into application

W9

Forgot Password

When user clicks on the link on Login mask

  • he gets a confirmation message that he will receive a mail

  • he gets a pw recovery mail from SSO provider with a link

  • when clicking on the link he is forwarded to a page where he can set a new password

  • once he confirms the password he is directly logged in the application

W10

Multifactor Authentication

  • Enable MFA option in SSO provider

  • Derive workflow from provider

  • Ideal workflow: see Okta MFA

    • …

    • E-mail

    • App

    • Biometrie

W11

Logout

In case user logs out from one application he will also be logged out from all other applications directly, ie session is killed (token expires)

W12

Registration

  • User registers in application with his data

    • name

    • first name

    • mail

    • (acccount name)

  • He gets the actvation mail with link

  • When clicking on the link he is forwarded to a page with

    • a preset e-mail address that cannot be edited

    • a pw input field

  • User is created in application with the following properties

    • Name

    • First name

    • E-mail

    • (Accout name?)

  • Sync user data and application url to SSO Provider and create new user

  • Activation mail to new user

  • In case e-mail is changed, the user gets a mail from SSO provider where he needs to confirm the change by clicking on a validation link

    • if user has not logged in yet, old data is being used

  • In case Name / First name is changed, no mail is sent by SSO provider at all

  • User data is changed centrally in SSO provider

    • New Name

    • New First name

    • New E-mail

    • (Accout name?)

  • As soon as user logs in one of the application SSO provider syncs user’s data to application

Alternative: Immediate Sync

Once user data are changed in one application, these are synced to SSO provider and all applications user has access to

Deletion

Deletion in application

  • In case a user is existing in several applications and he gets deleted in one of them then he will be removed from the application on SSO provider side

  • User can still use SSO in the application he is still existing

  • In case user is deleted from last application he is completely removed from SSO provider wrt

    • Name

    • First name

    • E-mail

    • (account name?)

    • PW

    • MFA

    • Application url

  • In case a deleted user tries to access the application he is removed from he would see an application based message, eg. you are not authorized to access this application

Deletion centrally in SSO provider (SHOULD DO)

In case user is deleted centrally from SSO provider a deletion process is triggerred automatically in all respective application

Federation

In case customer Active Directory is connected to SSO Provider when creating, updating or deleting a user on AD side, this will be synced over to SSO provider

Create

  • User will not be able to register by himself

  • When user is created on AD side and synced to SSO provider he will not receive a activation mail from SSO provider and he will not be asked to add a password

  • When user accesses application via sso (Login mask) his data will be double checked in SSO provider

    • if user is known, he will directly log into application

    • if user is not known, he will see an app based message

Edit

AD changes

When user data are changed in AD these are synced over to SSO provider once user logs into application and his data will be updated

Alternative: user changes from AD are pushed to SSO provider

Application / SSO provider changes

  • In case user data are changed in one application, these are synced to SSO provider or in case changes occur in SSO provider data are synced to application BUT

    • No data sync occurs to AD

  • When user logs out and logs in again AD data sync to SSO provider and overwrites the application changes

Deletion

Deletion in AD

When user is deleted within AD his data will be removed from SSO provider and from all applications

Deletion in application

see above and AD is untouched

Deletion in SSO provider

see above and AD is untouched

Login mask

  • The Tivian Access Login would contain two input fields

    • E-mail address

    • PW

    • Forgot PW link

  • In case user enters application url he needs to enter his mail

  • In case user accesses the application URL via mail, the email address woul be prefilled and cannot be edited

  • In case a wrong PW is entered, an error message appears

Forgot Password

When user clicks on the link on Login mask

  • he gets a confirmation message that he will receive a mail

  • he gets a pw recovery mail from SSO provider with a link

  • when clicking on the link he is forwarded to a page where he can set a new password

  • once he confirms the password he is directly logged in the application

Forgot Account?

Multifactor Authentication

  • Enable MFA option in SSO provider

  • Derive workflow from provider

  • Ideal workflow: see Okta MFA

    • name

    • first name

    • mail

    • (acccount name)

  • He gets the welcome mail with the link

  • When clicking on the link he is forwarded to a page with

    • a preset e-mail address that cannot be edited

To be dicussed / evaluated

  • E-mail as unique identifier?

    • If yes

      • e-mail will not be editable

      • in case user changes e-mail, a new user needs to be created, but previous data will be lost

    • If not

      • e-mail can be changed without any problem

      • user id could be used as unique identifier

      • user id needs to be added in each application

  • Layout (Tivian Access)

    • Can SSO-Provider handle logos and color changes?

  • Policies

    • Password

    • Token

  • Mail types (& content)

    • Activation

    • Forgot PW

    • (Welcome: information about new app access)

    • MFA

    • Support mail of the customer (in case of login issues)

  • Maintenance

  • Tenant Management
